newsitem.title: USA: Science Dynamics Q4 net $161,445, after write-off.
newsitem.headline: Science Dynamics Q4 net $161,445, after write-off.

text.p: Science Dynamics Corp said on Wednesday fourth quarter net income was $161,445 after providing for an inventory obsolescence write-off of $449,062.
In the year ago period, the company reported a net loss of $536,722.
Sales for the most recent fourth quarter rose 146 percent to $3,740,974.

The company said it expects first and second quarter sales to total less than $1 million as market development work proceeds with the company's new Innovative Communications Technology products and product development work begins in linking the company's Commander Platform with Innovative Communications data transmission products.
First quarter 1996 net sales were $548,481 and second quarter net sales were $628,461.
The company purchased Innovative Communications Technology in November to provide more expertise in the computer telephony integration area.

"Shipments of the new Commander Plus System with 3-way call detection, termination and automated operator service modules accounted for the majority of the sales for the fourth quarter, the company said. This was an exceedingly large sale and is not likely to be repeated in the next two quarters," the company said.
Results of the development efforts should begin to appear in the third and fourth quarters, the company said.
